titleStmt.title: The table of the Lord whereof, 1. The vvhole seruice, is the liuing bread. 2. The guests, any man. 3. The mouth to eate, faith onely. By Gilbert Primerose, Doctour of Divinitie, one of his Maiesties chaplaines in ordinary, and pastour of the French church at London.
titleStmt.author: Primrose, Gilbert, ca. 1580-1642.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I. D[awson] for Nicholas Bourne, and are to be sold at his shop at the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Consists of two sermons preached to the King in July, 1625.
Reproduction of the original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.

place.placeName: his shop at the Royall Exchange
